tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing. Together they intensify the command for the people to gather together in order to repent of their sins. AT: "gather yourselves together." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The nation is not sorry for their sins.

tn.ref: that day passes like the chaff
tn.text: The chaff is the insignificant part of the plant being thrown away and so this day will pass quickly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]]).

tn.ref: before the fierce anger of Yahweh's wrath comes upon you, before the day of the wrath of Yahweh comes upon you
tn.text: The prophet repeats the same phrase almost exactly in order to emphasize how terrible Yahweh's judgment will be and the urgency with which the people must repent. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]).
This stands for God's intent to punish. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: They will drive out Ashdod at noon, and they will uproot Ekron!
tn.text: The people will be quickly and completely removed from these cities.

tn.ref: So the seacoast will become ... for sheep pens
tn.text: Part of this verse's meaning is unclear and is translated in different ways by modern versions.
A sheep pen is a small area surrounded by a fence to keep the sheep together.
means to sleep in a bed.
"what Yahweh of hosts has declared" or "what Yahweh of hosts has solemnly said"

tn.ref: in the top of her columns
tn.text: When buildings were destroyed and fell down, the columns used for decoration and support would often remain standing.
Beams are long and thick pieces of wood that are used to keep a building stable.
A hiss is an angry sound. This phrase indicates extreme anger of the people toward Nineveh.
